FuncDef: This command enables the IS-IS Hello (IIH) message padding to ensure that IS-IS LSPs can traverse the link. When this option is enabled, IS-IS Hello messages are padded to the maximum LSP MTU value, which can be set with thelsp-mtu-sizecommand.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the adaptive padding option; this option is able to detect MTU asymmetry from one side of the connection but uses more overhead than loose padding.
Specifies the loose padding option; the loose padding may not be able to detect certain conditions such as asymmetrical MTUs between the routing devices.
Specifies that the Hello message padding is not enabled at this level, even if it is configured at one of the parent levels.
